beer.beer_description: A full-bodied, deep amber ale. With subtle hints of sultana, peppery ginger, warm cinnamon and orange zest. Made with a mulling recipe for a real Christmas taste and feel.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 370 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower.
It's cold outside - warm up with Winter beers. That's at least 10 different Winter beers try 5 more for Level 3!

beer.beer_description: Golden Cascade, Centennial and Fuggles hops used to give a light and aromatic character.
Our top selling, award winning, best bitter. A light amber colour, TEA is refreshing, hoppy and well balanced. Surely the best drink of the day!
Golden Cascade, Centennial and Fuggles hops used to give a light and aromatic character.

items.badge_description: While spontaneity can be fun, sometimes you want to make sure your adventure will rock. Checkout the menu at an Untappd Verified Venue before visiting and know exactly whats on tap! That's 300 check-ins at venue that is verified.  Try 5 more for Level 61!

beer.beer_description: A deep chestnut-coloured ale, perfect for enjoying by the fire on the crisp, wintery evenings of Advent leading up to Christmas. Our Advent Ale is brewed with the finest English malted barley and local hops, and has a refreshing, fruity nose, a sweet liquorice flavour and a rich dark chocolate aftertaste.
Golden Cascade, Centennial and Fuggles hops used to give a light and aromatic character.

4.5% ABV light, hoppy ale with a blend of floral and fresh citrus notes upfront, well-balanced with a long, dry finish. Hog IPA is brewed with a selection of fine English malts and locally grown Cascade and Fuggles hops, alongside US Centennial.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 50 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 11!

There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 50 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 11!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 80 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 17.

items.badge_description: It's time to celebrate! That's at least 5 birthdays on Untappd. You are an old-timer! Prost!

beer.beer_description: Golden Cascade, Centennial and Fuggles hops used to give a light and aromatic character.

items.badge_description: Fresh from the tap is one of the best ways to enjoy a beer. Just try to use a glass and not drink directly from the tap, as tempting as it may be. That's 345 checkins with the serving style of Draft. Try 5 more for Level 70!
We believe in IPA and you should too. You certainly have a taste for the hops! That's 185 different IPAs. Try 5 more for Level 38! Want to learn more about this badge? Check out our podcast

While a pint of traditional English ale will always remain a staple, the craft beer scene in England, much like the rest of the world, has continued to grow at a rapid rate! That's 405 different beers from a brewery from England! Try 5 more for Level 82!

beer.beer_description: Golden Cascade, Centennial and Fuggles hops used to give a light and aromatic character.
Dark Chestnut Ale
Our top selling, award winning, best bitter. A light amber colour, TEA is refreshing, hoppy and well balanced. Surely the best drink of the day!

Our latest cocktail inspired Pale Ale is light, refreshing and full of flavour. 
Brewer with award-winning home-grown Cascade hops gor a burst of chesty citrus, perfectly partnered by ripe strawberry notes for that extra twist.

A deep chestnut-coloured ale, perfect for enjoying by the fire on the crisp, wintery evenings of Advent leading up to Christmas. Our Advent Ale is brewed with the finest English malted barley and local hops, and has a refreshing, fruity nose, a sweet liquorice flavour and a rich dark chocolate aftertaste.

beer.beer_description: Dark Chestnut Ale

user.bio: Yorkshireman, CAMRA Member and Cask & Craft beer drinker!
Husband | Father | Sales Manager | Seeker of Craft Beer and a Jedi, like My Father before Me.
Hardcore Gamer (X-Box Series X & Switch), Comic book fan, Hardcore Gym geek, Wrestling fan & Craft beer fan & traveling!
Born in Ormskirk, raised in Burscough also formerly of Preston & Aintree, now in Old Roan.

beer.beer_description: Our top selling, award winning, best bitter. A light amber colour, TEA is refreshing, hoppy and well balanced. Surely the best drink of the day!

HOGSTAR is a rich-straw, golden yellow colour with a distinctive gently hopped aroma. A fuller taste with a good balance between sweetness and bitterness. Brewed with 5 hops and herb extracts, and longer matured for a fuller, deeper flavor.
Golden Cascade, Centennial and Fuggles hops used to give a light and aromatic character.

A light and refreshing pale golden beer with hints of banana and pineapple. Crafted with a fine blend of the best English malted barley and mainly fresh local Fuggles hops from Puttenham but with some aroma hops at the end of the boil. A good balanced beer with a long dry finish and a sense of sweetness.
Refreshingly cloudy English cider, brewed in conjunction with Thatchers.
Relax and enjoy this fine ale. Brewed to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the Royal Horticultural Society at Wisley, Surrey 1903-2003.

A deep chestnut-coloured ale, perfect for enjoying by the fire on the crisp, wintery evenings of Advent leading up to Christmas. Our Advent Ale is brewed with the finest English malted barley and local hops, and has a refreshing, fruity nose, a sweet liquorice flavour and a rich dark chocolate aftertaste.

A reddish amber bitter, malty but with refreshing hoppy high notes on the taste. RIP Snorter is brewed with the finest English pale malt combined with some crystal malt and a touch of chocolate malt. Then we add a combination of local Fuggles and Golding hops at three stages during the copper boil.

A fresh,Golden bitter with rich, Earthy, Peppery notes and a long, Dry finish. Brewed with fine English Malts and Farnham white Bine whole hop flowers. 

100 years ago, fields full of Farnham White Bine hops were a common sight around Farnham. Sadly these have all gone. 

But our brewers have revived this famous hop in our very own hop garden. Our first crop was harvested on September 17th, 2015 and was used to brew this unique beer. 

No-one else grows Farnham White Bine Hops. Enjoy your own glass of history.
A strong black beer with rich, complex aromas & taste. Smooth with powerful roasted malt flavours.

4.5% ABV light, hoppy ale with a blend of floral and fresh citrus notes upfront, well-balanced with a long, dry finish. Hog IPA is brewed with a selection of fine English malts and locally grown Cascade and Fuggles hops, alongside US Centennial.
An easy drinking light amber bitter with a fragrant citrus hop aroma, leading to subtle malty and citrus fruits on the palate. A slight bittersweet finish with a light malty after-taste.

Brewed in small batches and matured in the brewery cellar, like a fine wine. Made from high quality English malted barley, Kent Goldings hops are added for bitterness and aroma and Bramling Cross to further enhance the character, resulting in deep, rich and complex flavours of sultanas, orange peel and plums. Enjoy as you would a fortified wine, in a wine glass or a brandy balloon, to concentrate its wonderful aroma.
Easy drinking but with bags of taste, Englands Glory has strong robust malty tones with slight citrus hints  often described as caramel orange.

Brewed for the Brooklands Museum, Gold Star is a light golden beer with both floral hoppy aroma and some fruit notes in the taste. The name refers to the medal awarded to drivers competing around the Surrey track.
East Coast IPA

This ruby beer has an enticing malty aroma, with gentle
spice notes leading to a powerful malty flavour with hints of plum, balanced by generous refreshing hoppy notes.
Hogswallop is a malty, rye beer with spicy notes and a hoppy finish

This new golden-coloured seasonal ale delivers a blend of floral and citrus notes in both the aroma and flavour, with subtle malt notes giving a fine balance to the light, hoppy character  culminating in a long, dry finish.

Hops: Fuggles, Mosaic, UK Cascade

Three Hogs coming home! To celebrate England's route to the World Cup final, we have today released our new Golden summer ale, Three Hogs. Made with 5 hops; it has a sweet, citrus aroma and a pleasant, bitter finish - hopefully unlike our team's fortunes! Available now from our brewery shop and in pubs across the South East.
A full-bodied, deep amber ale. With subtle hints of sultana, peppery ginger, warm cinnamon and orange zest. Made with a mulling recipe for a real Christmas taste and feel.

Its 4.5%, hazy and heavily hopped.

This full-hopped golden beauty is brewed with Mosaic and our home-grown Cascade in the copper, and dry-hopped with more Cascade, Ekuanot and Azacca  named after the Haitian god of agriculture.

With a beautiful blend of citrus, mango and tropical fruit notes, its mellow and moreish, with the trademark Phantom haze.

Our famous limited brew honey ale.

Brewed with 100% Fuggles in the copper, and dry-hopped late in the fermentation process, with added honey, it has all the balance of TEA, with a subtle sweet finish.
